section.p: does not implement the setEscapeProcessing method of java.sql.Statement. In addition, the cancel method raises a "Feature not supported" exception.
The following table describes features of Statement methods that are specific to .

table.title: Implementation notes on Statement methods
table.desc: This table describes the implementation-specific features of Statement methods, providing the return type and signature for each method.

row.entry: If the user has indicated that auto-generated keys should be made available, this method returns the same results as a call to the IDENTITY_VAL_LOCAL function. Otherwise this method returns null.
Every column index in the array must correlate to an auto-increment column within the target table of the INSERT. Supported in embedded mode only.
Every column name in the array must designate an auto-increment column within the target table of the INSERT. Supported in embedded mode only.
Every column index in the array must correlate to an auto-increment column within the target table of the INSERT. Supported in embedded mode only.
Every column name in the array must designate an auto-increment column within the target table of the INSERT. Supported in embedded mode only.
